46:02 Caption: The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
46:59 Caption: The fans in the stadium won't regret buying tickets for today's game as they have witnessed a great game so far, and nothing suggests it's going to change in the second half. It has been a tight contest so far. The home side relies mostly on counter-attacks for their chances, while the away team adopts the opposite approach of possession football.

The ball goes out of play. Dortmund are awarded a corner kick.

48:07 Caption: Felix Passlack sends a terrific cross into the box. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) gets on the end of it but his header from the centre of the box goes just over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Ingolstadt.
49:03 Caption: That's it for today, Felix Zwayer has blown his whistle and the game is over.
49:59 Caption: What a thrilling encounter, there was plenty of goal mouth action. Both teams tried unsuccessfully to control the game. Their overall performances were more or less even. The home players attempted to beat the opposition's defence using mostly counter-attacks. The away team tried to prevail using combination football.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
The thrilling encounter between Ingolstadt and Dortmund finished in a dramatic 3-3 draw after a contest filled with intense action, dazzling goals, and a roller-coaster of emotions for both sets of fans. The match, staged at a vibrant and charged atmosphere, unfolded with a series of significant moments which kept the audience on the edge of their seats from the first whistle to the last. Here is a detailed recount of the game's most pivotal and action-packed events:

The first half commenced with Dortmund kicking off proceedings, eager to establish their dominance early on. However, it was Ingolstadt who drew first blood. Despite an initial period of back-and-forth play, with both teams struggling to retain possession and meaningful build-up play often getting disrupted, Ingolstadt found an opportunity to make their presence felt. The breakthrough for Ingolstadt came in the 5th minute. Following a sequence of play where Ingolstadt had managed to earn themselves an indirect free-kick, a well-aimed shot was on target before it nestled in the back of the net, giving them a 1-0 lead. The goal can be credited largely due to Pascal Gross' shrewd play to find his teammate, Dario Lezcano, who capitalized beautifully on the chance.

As Dortmund kicked off again at the 6:31 mark, they were soon handed another free-kick following a foul by an eager Ingolstadt defender. The determined visitors replied swiftly, pushing forward to level the scoring. Ousmane Dembele was particularly lively, showing his dribbling prowess on several occasions, yet his attempts failed to challenge Orjan Nyland significantly—until the 15:14 mark, when Dembele's effort from just outside the box was neatly gathered by Nyland.

Adrian Ramos came close shortly after, demonstrating relentless effort as he rose for a header following a precise cross from Gonzalo Castro, only to be thwarted by a stunning save from Orjan Nyland. Amidst sporadic spells where Ingolstadt cleared their lines defensively, Dortmund's persistence offered them another gilt-edged chance as Dembele's lively presence again created opportunities.

However, it was the 23rd minute when Ingolstadt doubled their lead. This was again a testament to Dario Lezcano's aerial prowess as he unleashed a thunderous header from a well-orchestrated free-kick. The text-book header pierced the left post, rendering Roman Weidenfeller helpless. As the match resumed, the fouling trend continued with Ingolstadt often resorting to tough challenges to disrupt Dortmund's rhythm. At the 28:04 mark, Gonzalo Castro's edge-of-the-box shot was parried away brilliantly by Nyland, who was having a marvellous first-half.

Ingolstadt was not to be confined to their half either and created several notable chances in the latter part of the first half. Dario Lezcano came close yet again in the 43rd minute, driving a low shot to the bottom-right corner, forcing a corner after Weidenfeller's save. The half concluded with missed opportunities by both sides and another crucial save from Weidenfeller, denying Almog Cohen's rebound shot from the edge of the box.

Second half commenced with changes to Dortmund's lineup in hopes of turning around their fortunes. Christian Pulisic replaced Joo-Ho Park, adding an attacking impetus to the away side. The substitutions seemed to imbue Dortmund with renewed vigor and a heightened sense of urgency. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang, in particular, was more involved; it didn’t take long for their efforts to bear fruit. In the 58th minute, Aubameyang leaped to meet a cross and redirected the ball with a powerful header into the left post, reducing the deficit and making it 2-1.

The euphoria on Dortmund’s bench was short-lived, however, as Florent Hadergjonaj promptly set up Dario Lezcano in the very next minute. Lezcano, in a well-anticipated maneuver, smashed a perfect strike into the middle of the goal, thereby reinstating Ingolstadt’s two-goal cushion.

Yet, Dortmund seemed undeterred by the setback. They mounted pressure continually and were finally rewarded in the 69th minute. This time it was Adrian Ramos, who showcased his intelligent movement and clinical finishing. Latching onto Christian Pulisic's affordably crafted pass, Ramos slid the ball with precision into the centre of the net. The goals kept coming, and the game’s frantic pace hardly mellowed.

The persistent threats from Dortmund meant Ingolstadt's defence had to remain resolutely strong. Yet, the defining episode of this encounter emerged late in the game. A tug-of-war ensued with Ingolstadt trying to hold onto their slim lead while Dortmund’s exploits became relentless. The visitor's persistence paid off when Lukasz Piszczek’s header was saved, but the ball rebounded to Christian Pulisic who coolly slotted it into the net making it a dramatic 3-3.

As full-time neared, Ingolstadt made tactical substitutions hoping to thwart Dortmund’s relentless advance and see out the match to salvage a point. Both managers shuffled their lineup, infusing the game with fresh legs to eke out a late winner. Despite further attempts from key players, notably from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang and Ousmane Dembele, who came close on multiple occasions, the scores remained tied at the final whistle. The game's end was signified by a stunning missed header from Aubameyang, whose attempt from the centre of the box flew just over the bar in the dying moments.

This game was a definitive showcase of football’s unpredictable nature and the unyielding spirit of competition. Ingolstadt displayed entrenched resilience and clinical finishing skills, while Dortmund demonstrated a never-say-die attitude characterized by relentless attacking play, engineering opportunities under the orchestrations of players like Pulisic, Dembele, and Ramos. The pulsating match witnessed milestones and vital individual displays that will be etched in the remarkable annals of football narratives for both clubs.

In conclusion, this encounter was a testament to the sheer entertainment football offers, illustrating the highs and lows, the feats of skill, and the drama that make the sport so enthralling. Both teams earned their points, showcasing determination and footballing prowess, and leaving fans with cherished memories of a football spectacle.
